# Task

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.



# Data

df = DataFrame(dt=[DateTime(2020, 5, 24), DateTime(2021, 1, 15), DateTime(2022, 12, 5)])
add_yearmonth(df)

Here is a Julia function that solves the problem:

```julia
using DataFrames, Dates

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = map(x -> Dates.year(x)*100 + Dates.month(x), df.dt)
end
```

This function takes a DataFrame as input and adds a new column `ym` to it. The values in this new column are calculated from the original DateTime column `dt` by extracting the year and month from each DateTime object and concatenating them together as an integer in format “yyyymm”. 

Here is how you can use this function with your data:

```julia
using DataFrames, Dates

df = DataFrame(dt=[DateTime(2020, 5, 24), DateTime(2021, 1, 15), DateTime(2022, 12, 5)])
add_yearmonth(df)
```
This will add a new column `ym` to the DataFrame with values: [202005, 202101, 202212].
